This won't solve your problem but might shed some ligt on what an
unrooted =
test is (a weak comfort).

I have managed to cause unrooted tests earlier i=
n my RSpec-JUnit
hack. Based on that experience an "unrooted test" is a tes=
t that is
run without having been declared previously by the runner (in my =
case
I had to fix my runner implementation that was, no doubt, not behaving=

acording to spec). It would probably not hurt to ask this question in
an E=
clipse forum aswell, it seems that exlipse single-test runner is
doing some=
thing that is not quite correct.

/J
